description:
The story centers around class 1-7 of Tennogofune Academy, where all the students with "bad karma" or misfortune seem to have been gathered. Hibari, a student in this class, meets the unlucky Hanako and the perennially unhealthy Botan on her first day of school, and together they try to find a way to turn their school life into a happy one.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

node.description: [Website](https://suzuri.jp/cotoji69) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/cotoji_69) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/267712) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/cotoji_69/) | [Misskey](https://misskey.niri.la/@coto_69) | [Skeb](https://skeb.jp/@cotoji_69) | [Blog](http://cotoji69.blog.fc2.com/)

Affiliated with Studio Live. Admires [Kazuko Tadano](https://anilist.co/staff/118426/).

Her designs are very shoujo manga like, often featuring glittering eyes.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大沼心) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Oonuma)

After graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology he joined Office AO where he worked as an animator. He later joined Shaft in 2004 as a subcontractor, and he became [Akiyuki Shinbou's](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/) right hand until 2009. When he stopped working for Shaft, he found his new home at studio Silver Link, where he is to-date known as their most prominent director. Noted for directing shows such as [ef: A Tale of Melodies](https://anilist.co/anime/4789/), [Baka to Test](https://anilist.co/anime/6347/) and [Kokoro Connect](https://anilist.co/anime/11887/).

Oonuma is known to like so called moe games.

Affiliated with Studio Live. Admires [Kazuko Tadano](https://anilist.co/staff/118426/).

Her designs are very shoujo manga like, often featuring glittering eyes.

__Agency:__ Toy's Factory

[ToysFactory Profile](https://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/harukashiraishi/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/shiraishi-haruka/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shiraharu48?s=09)

Haruka Shiraishi is a Japanese actress and voice actress. She was previously affiliated with Hirata Office, but is currently affiliated with Toy's Factory.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Rupee - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Folkwang - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Blücher - Azur Lane
- Agano - Azur Lane
- Le Malin - Azur Lane
- Erina - Tevi (VG)
- Grace Howard - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hibiku_yamamura)

[Website](https://avex.jp/kiyono-yasuno/) | [Blog](https://profile.ameba.jp/ameba/kiyono-yasuno) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yaskiyo_manager) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%AE%89%E9%87%8E%E5%B8%8C%E4%B8%96%E4%B9%83) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCEQScK4V7gy34xEFGjNH6Hw) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kiyonon_at_home/)

Kiyono's hobbies are watching stage plays, films, comics / manga and singing karaoke.

Kiyono Yasuno is a member of the real-life idol group [Walküre](https://anilist.co/staff/226500/Walkre)

__Non-Anime Roles__

- [Hoshiguma](https://anilist.co/character/174800/) - Arknights (VG)

[Agency (81produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=335) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshioka_mayuc) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yoshioka_mayuc/)

- Mercedes von Martritz - Fire Emblem Three Houses (Video Game)
- NEKO#ΦωΦ - Muse Dash (Video Game)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/733174574045495296)

Affiliated with [ENGI](https://anilist.co/studio/6292/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/6049302)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/6049302)

[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/kosaki) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_kosaki)

A Japanese composer and arranger. He joined NAMCO as a soundtrack composer in 1999, and then he joined MONACA Inc. as a music designer in 2004.

Soundtracks he has worked on credited as MONACA: 
- Star Driver: Kagayaki no Takuto (with Keigo Hoashi and Ryuichi Takada) 
- Hourou Musuko (with Keigo Hoashi and Keiichi Okabe) 
- A-Channel (with Kakeru Ishihama, Ryuichi Takada, Keigo Hoashi)

[Website](https://monaca.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_jp)

__MONACA__ is a Japanese music production studio, which was established by the composer Keiichi Okabe in October 2004.

__Members__:
• [Keiichi Okabe](https://anilist.co/staff/121585/Keiichi-Okabe) (CEO)
• [Satoru Kousaki](https://anilist.co/staff/101555/Satoru-Kousaki)
• [Ryuuichi Takada](https://anilist.co/staff/109459/Ryuuichi-Takada)
• [Kakeru Ishihama](https://anilist.co/staff/150946/Kakeru-Ishihama)
• [Hidekazu Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/141852/Hidekazu-Tanaka)
• [Keiichi Hirokawa](https://anilist.co/staff/156490/Keiichi-Hirokawa)
• [Kuniyuki Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/154774/Kuniyuki-Takahashi)
• [Shuotarou Seo](https://anilist.co/staff/317330/Shoutarou-Seo)
• [Oliver Good](https://anilist.co/staff/317296)
• [Keita Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/229376/Keita-Inoue)

__Past Members__:
• [Yuri Mitsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/201236/Yuri-Misumi)
• [Keigo Hoashi](https://anilist.co/staff/111233/Keigo-Hoashi)
A composer affiliated with MONACA since 2015

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/HdkzTanaka)

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kobe University (Faculty of Developmental Sciences, Department of Human Representation)

__Hidekazu Tanaka__ is a Japanese composer and arranger.

He left MONACA on July 31, 2021, and went independent. 

On October 24, 2022, he was arrested on suspicion of sexual assault of a teenage girl in Meguro, Tokyo in August of that year. On March 15, 2023, Tanaka admitted to obscenity charges which included saying obscene language to a 15-year-old girl, along with admitting to voyeurism at least dozens of times in the past 10 years.

__[Artist Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/hirokawa.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kayone87)__

__Keiichi Hirokawa__ is a Japanese music composer and arranger who belongs to sound production studio MONACA.

[Twitter](https://x.com/KeigoHoashi)

Keigo Hoashi is a composer and arranger, and a pianist. He was formerly part of the unit [MONACA](https://anilist.co/staff/110481/MONACA).

__[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/okabe)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_okabe)__

__Keiichi Okabe__ is a Japanese vocalist, composer and arranger, who is particularly known for composing soundtracks for game producers Square Enix and Bandai Namco, which include various soundtracks for the Nier, Drakengard, and Tekken series. He is also the founder and CEO of music and sound production studio, MONACA.

[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/ishihama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_ishihama)

A composer affiliated with [MONACA](https://anilist.co/staff/110481/MONACA) since spring 2008.

[Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/takahashi.html)

Japanese composer and arranger working for music production company MONACA since 2013. He is a graduate of Hokkaido University of Education.

Assistant planner at Houbunsha.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [Capcom employee](https://anilist.co/staff/237972/)._
